alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Tuscaloosa and southwestern Jefferson Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 211 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Deerlick Creek Campgrounds, or 8 miles northeast of Holt, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bessemer, Hueytown, Pleasant Grove, Lake View, Brookwood, Sylvan Springs, Maytown, North Johns, Bull City, Abernant, Splash Adventure, Concord, Deerlick Creek Campgrounds, Bankhead Lock And Dam, Promenade Tannehill, East Brookwood, Bent Brook Golf Club, Lake Harris, Lake Nicol and McCalla. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central and west central Alabama.
